DataElement.preferredName: Histological Or Cytopathological Diagnosis Unresectable Colorectal Cancer With KRAS Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that describes if patient has histological  cytopathological diagnosis of advanced/metastatic unresectable colorectal cancer with known KRAS.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Histological Or Cytopathological Diagnosis Unresectable Colorectal Cancer With KRAS
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._That portion of the cell contained within the plasma membrane but excluding the nucleus._The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Unable to be removed with surgery._A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the colon or rectum and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._This gene is involved in signal transduction and apoptosis.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
That portion of the cell contained within the plasma membrane but excluding the nucleus.

The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredName: Unresectable Colorectal Carcinoma With KRAS Gene
Property.preferredDefinition: Unable to be removed with surgery.:A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the colon or rectum and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:This gene is involved in signal transduction and apoptosis.

Concepts.definition: Not capable of being removed by surgery.
A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the colon or rectum and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
This gene is involved in signal transduction and apoptosis.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Cohort expansion phase: Does
ReferenceDocuments.description: Cohort expansion phase: Does patient have histological  cytopathological diagnosis of advanced/metastatic unresectable colorectal cancer with known KRAS?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically- or cytologically-confirmed diagnosis of KRAS mutation-positive malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Cohort expansion phase:  Does patient have histological cytopathological diagnosis of advanced/metastatic unresectable colorectal cancer with known RAS mutational status?
